intro: Pavetta petiolaris, commonly known as the small-leaved pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Pavetta petiolaris is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
